intro: Pentacarya heliotropoides, commonly known as the sunflower tree, is a member of the Asteraceae family and is native to South America. It is a deciduous tree that can grow up to 10 meters tall, characterized by its smooth, gray bark and palmate leaves. The plant produces yellow flowers in terminal clusters, which bloom in the spring and summer. Its botanical features include a fibrous root system and the ability to thrive in well-drained soils. The plant is often cultivated for its ornamental value and has some traditional medicinal uses.
